predictions.reasoning: Member comment from sebslight appears to be a template closure notice ('If this is incorrect, comment and we can reopen'). First-time contributor (0 prior PRs), 0% merge rate. No human reviewer approval. The member comment pattern matches P-6-3: explicit duplicate/closure language with reopen condition is a terminal non-merge signal. XS-sized PR with only automated (greptile) and author reviews.

Contributor comment from Glucksberg states 'This appears to be a [duplicate/related]' and directs to multiple related PRs (#4798, #4822, etc.). This matches P-3-1 (supersession pattern): a contributor comment indicating the work has been absorbed or is redundant is a terminal non-merge signal. First-time contributor (0 prior PRs), 0% merge rate. Only automated review. No human approval.

Terminal non-merge signal per P-6-5: automated triage bot comment (openclaw-barnacle) explicitly closes PR for exceeding 20 labels. Comment repeats twice for emphasis. PR has 44 labels (well above threshold) and 1088 files changed (massive scope). Matches P-5-2: 'PRs with 270+ files and 20+ labels are closed by automated triage as "too noisy"'. Author has 0% merge rate (1 prior PR). This is a deterministic auto-closure signal that overrides all other factors.

Author WeatherPal-AI has 2 prior PRs with 0% merge rate, matching P-4-1 pattern. XS-sized PR (1 file) with only automated reviews (greptile, HenryLoenwind comment with no approval). No human reviewer approval. No maintainer label. No maintainer comment beyond automated engagement. Pattern P-4-1: 'Authors with 0% merge rate across multiple prior PRs (4+) are unlikely to merge new PRs even with approval signals from non-maintainer reviewers.' While author has only 2 prior PRs (not 4+), the combination of 0% rate and no human approval is non-merge signal.

Duplicate of PR #11368 (same file, same fix, same author, created 16 minutes later). Author WeatherPal-AI has 12 prior PRs with 0% merge rate, matching P-4-1 pattern. XS-sized PR (1 file), no reviews, no comments, no maintainer label. The PR appears to be a resubmission after the first attempt. Zero engagement and 0% author history indicate non-merge. Superseded by earlier PR #11368.

First-time contributor (0 prior PRs, 0% merge rate). Feature PR (5 files, M-sized scope). Only automated greptile review with technical objections noted (hook type mismatch, casting issues). No human reviewer approval. No maintainer label. No maintainer comment. Matches P-1-3: 'First-time contributors with high comment engagement but no human reviewer approval have low merge probability.' The greptile comment flags technical problems without resolution. Lacks human reviewer engagement needed for first-time feature PR.

Member comment from thewilloftheshadow explicitly closes PR with reason: 'Auto-closing PR, shtse8 has been blocked due to spamming PRs and letting AI agents send slop and clogging our review queue'. This is a terminal non-merge signal: member-issued auto-closure with explicit blocklist notation. Even though author has 81 prior PRs (81 > 50), 3 merges (3.7% rate), and no commit-hash-backed merge receipt is present, the member's explicit closure statement overrides any positive signals. This matches behavioral pattern of blocked/banned authors.

Author RocketMan234 has 7 prior PRs with 0% merge rate, matching P-4-1 pattern. XS-sized PR (2 files, auto-generated protocol models). Zero reviews, zero comments. No human engagement. No maintainer label. Pure chore/maintenance task with no test coverage. Matches P-4-1: authors with 0% merge rate on multiple prior PRs are unlikely to merge new PRs without maintainer engagement. Automated code generation with no validation signals.

Author BinHPdev posted self-closing comment: 'Closing: consolidating open PRs to focus on higher-impact fixes.' This is explicit author intent to close the PR, matching P-3-2 (author comment explicitly states PR is superseded). Earlier comment shows author validation ('Local validation: pnpm build... all passed') but author then self-closes anyway. Author has 49 prior PRs with 3 merges (6.1% rate) and XS-sized fix. Prior self-advocacy without maintainer engagement led to closure. This is terminal non-merge signal per author's own closure statement.

Author Solvely-Colin has 10 prior PRs with 0% merge rate, matching P-4-1 pattern. XL-sized PR (19 files, extensive Slack integration changes). Zero reviews, zero comments, zero human engagement. No maintainer label. No maintainer comment. Matches P-1-1: 'Large feature PRs (XL size, 20+ files) from first-time contributors without maintainer labels are unlikely to merge.' While author is not first-time (10 prior PRs), the 0% merge rate combined with XL scope and zero engagement is a strong non-merge signal. Large refactor with high risk profile.

Author explicitly states 'Closing to resubmit cleanly on latest main' — this is a terminal closure signal. The PR is intentionally being withdrawn to be resubmitted. Despite addressing review feedback and having automated reviews, the author's own closure comment overrides all other signals. Pattern P-3-1 applies: author explicitly closes the PR.

Member sebslight comments 'Already fixed in main' — this is a terminal non-merge signal per Pattern P-2-4. The fix has landed elsewhere on main, indicating the PR will not be merged independently. Author vishaltandale00 has 0% prior merge rate across 22 PRs, compounding the signal. The member statement overrides all other engagement signals including author responsiveness, CI passing, and iterative fixes.

First-time contributor (0 prior PRs, 0% merge rate) adding a new channel with no human reviewer engagement, no approval, and no maintainer label. This is a medium-scope feature addition (3 files, docs + template). Pattern P-1-7 applies: medium-sized feature PRs from first-time contributors without maintainer approval or label do not reliably merge. The lack of any human review comment or approval combined with first-time status predicts non-merge.

XL-sized PR (21 files, labeled 'size: XL') from first-time contributor (0 prior PRs, 0% merge rate) with no human reviewer approval and only automated Greptile reviews identifying multiple unresolved technical issues. Multiple review cycles with greptile identifying handler unregistration, dispatcher reservation leaks, and incomplete path handling suggest substantive technical concerns remain unaddressed. Pattern P-1-4 applies: XL-sized PRs from first-time contributors without maintainer labels are unlikely to merge. Combined with Pattern P-4-1 (no human reviewer engagement despite concerns raised), this predicts non-merge.

The account ban takes precedence over the XS-sized fix and prior author history (97 prior PRs, 19.6% merge rate). A banned user's PRs will not be merged regardless of technical merit or code review approval.

Author Limitless2023 explicitly closes the PR with comment: 'Closing — debug log shows incorrect clamped value.' This is a terminal closure signal per Pattern P-3-1. Author mudrii explicitly closes with: 'Closing — fixed upstream in v2026.2.15 via [commit hashes] (skipRecompute option...) + [commit hash] (re-arm timer in finally block). Same root cause (#9788).' This is a supersession/non-merge signal per Pattern P-2-4 and P-5-1. The author indicates the underlying issue has been fixed via separate commits on the main branch, making this PR redundant. The explicit supersession by upstream commits overrides the 33.3% prior merge rate and XS size. This is a terminal closure signal.

Author explicitly states PR #7459 is a duplicate of this one, indicating supersession. Per P-1-2 and P-3-1, author supersession comments are terminal non-merge signals. First-time contributor (0 prior PRs) with zero human reviewer engagement (only automated Greptile review) compounds the signal.

Both authored by sauerdaniel, both created 2026-02-17 within 1 minute of each other, both explicitly marked as 'Duplicate of original PR which was reopened' in author comments.
